meanings.definition: To cause intense pain or suffering to
meanings.sent1: The loud noise excruciated my ears.
meanings.sent2: The dentist's drill can excruciate patients.
meanings.sent3: The spicy food excruciated his taste buds.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending wait at the doctor's office excruciated her patience.
meanings.sent5: The icy wind excruciated my exposed skin.

meanings.sent1: The bully would excruciate the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was to excruciate the hero before revealing the truth.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten would excruciate the dog by stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories would excruciate her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The relentless teasing would excruciate his self-esteem.

meanings.definition: To inflict severe mental or physical pain on
meanings.sent1: The tragic news excruciated her heart.
meanings.sent2: The loss of a loved one can excruciate a person's soul.
meanings.sent3: The suspenseful movie excruciated his nerves.
meanings.sent4: The guilt of his actions excruciated his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's injury excruciated his chances of winning the race.
